title: Holiday Flagship Early-Access & Pop-up Tests
highlights: Target pack unifies footfall, early-window share, CPA and QR redemption goals to judge success.
A/B frame compares legacy markdown (Arm A) to bundle+GWP+loyalty (Arm B) inside the same two‑week window to measure incremental impact.
Measurement and POS→loyalty mapping must be completed in the next 30 days to avoid attribution gaps.
executive_summary: Operators should execute a unified holiday target pack: **10–15%** detectable foot‑traffic uplift (stretch goal **≥25%** in top markets), an early‑window transaction share goal of **20–30%** (vs **~12–15%** baseline), Event CPA target **≤0.80×** baseline, and QR/scan redemption **≥5%** of footfall. The test will be framed as Arm A (legacy markdown) vs Arm B (bundle+GWP+loyalty) inside the same two‑week window to isolate offer mechanics and incremental loyalty lift. Collaboration teams must, within **30 days**, finalize offers and staffing, instrument door counts/QR→POS and payment→loyalty mapping, and stand up an A/B holdout plus daily reporting to track attribution and hit the targets [^1][^4][^3].
top_operator_moves: Stand up a two‑arm A/B holdout across matched stores with the two‑week early-access window.
Instrument door counts, QR→POS redemption linkage and payment→loyalty transaction mapping for daily reporting.
Prioritize Arm B rollouts in top markets to chase the **≥25%** stretch footfall uplift while preserving AOV.
